intro: Guatteria sodiroi, commonly known as the Mexican huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, typically growing in humid, tropical lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a fleshy, edible berry that is often consumed by local communities. Guatteria sodiroi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
